snippet: The state comptroller, Leslie Munger, said Friday she would not follow an executive order by Gov. Bruce Rauner to hold up so-called fair-share union dues from nonunion workers.
abstract: Illinois State Comptroller Leslie Munger says she will defy executive order from Gov Bruce Rauner to hold in escrow fair-share union dues from nonunion workers and instead heed guidance of State Atty Gen Lisa Madigan, who says fees are covered by union contracts and executive orders do not apply.
lead_paragraph: The state comptroller, Leslie Munger, said Friday she would not follow an executive order by Gov. Bruce Rauner to hold up so-called fair-share union dues from nonunion workers.

headline.main: Illinois: Official Refuses Order to Halt Union Fees
headline.print_headline: Illinois: Official Refuses Order to Halt Union Fees
